did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: A. Philip Randolph Papers on Microfilm,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Accompanied by printed reel guide compiled by David H. Werning.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: A. Philip Randolph (1889-1979) was one of the leading black protest leaders of the twentieth century. He was best known as the editor of the Messenger (a radical Socialist journal), as organizer of the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters, and as the leader of the 1941 and 1963 Marches on Washington.
